description: Table read by antidiagonals where T(n,k) is coefficient of x^k in (1-x)^n/(1-2x)^n.
comments: Contribution from _Paul Barry_, Nov 10 2008: (Start)As number triangle, Riordan array (1, x(1-x)/(1-2x)). A062110*A007318 is A147703.[0,1,1,0,0,0,....] DELTA [1,0,0,0,.....] (Deleham DELTA defined in A084938). (End)Modulo 2, this sequence becomes A106344 . [From _Philippe Deléham_, Dec 18 2008]
mathematica: t[n_, n_] = 1; t[n_, k_] := 2^(n-2*k)*k*Hypergeometric2F1[1-k, n-k+1, 2, -1]; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Oct 30 2013, after Philippe Deléham + symbolic sum *)
crossrefs: Columns include A000012, A001477, A000096, A000297. Main diagonal is A002002. T(n, k) is a multiple of 2^(k-n), dividing by this gives a table similar to A050143 except at the edges.
Essentially the same array as A105306, A160232.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 30 2001
